_r1-uuDJ0vgH_zwht7kfzg.text: Ordered take-out from this place over the weekend. It came relatively fast (within a half hour) and was decent enough. My Pad See Eiw just didn't ... taste right. I don't know what it was, but it didn't make me jump up and scream 'Yes! I've just eaten one of my favourite dishes in the world!' more like 'Eh...well, I just had my favourite dish done in a very mediocre way.' Also tried a Thai Fish cake that had the texture of a piece of egg from McDonalds. You know, squishy egg-but-notreally-egg texture on your Egg McMuffin. Think that. But it's supposed to be fish. Mmmm....Right.My friends enjoyed their Pad Thai and another spicy noodle dish but I just wasn't all that impressed. Maybe in a pinch, maybe actually dining in but not a go-to take out place.

TAcnXHLl2txzdN8tVZcUdw.text: Grilled calamari and thai peanut salad as starters, delicious. Tamarind duck main with coconut rice was very nice. The sauce was sweet and the crunchy topping was a great touch. The duck is served on top of pok choi (I think) and that was a good complement,  adding some crisp veg flavor. My dinner companion had a jungle curry with chicken - he found out a little runnier/more watery than he would have liked. So the food was good. The ambience much better than anticipated. But the service left something to be desired. They messed up our bill.  So 3 stars. This part is more about our annoying experience with some rude patrons, so read for your own amusement of you like ... We had a booking.  A couple of rude Scandinavian guys sat down after us, at the table behind us, without a booking. We ordered our drinks, starters, and mains. Then before the server could take our orders to the kitchen, the guys behind us demanded that they place their order before she run off. Unfortunately the poor server felt compelled to do so. Then the rude guys sat there having a long dialogue with the server about every detail of every item on the menu for about ten minutes. Delaying our food. The server was not bold enough to say something to the guys and get away. After she left I said something to them however.  They said they were just SO HUNGRY they couldn't wait (implying our hunger could wait, though)...and they said it was because  there was only one server. This was not true. There were at least three walking around! Maybe these guys couldn't tell them apart (though actually one was a man)?? Hey fellow diners...Don't be jerks!!

scuAJVyH_cXKonpoU8wsTg.text: It was a hard choice between pad kee mau with duck (my usual favourite) or the deliciously described deep-fried sea bass with spicy thai dressing. I went the deep-fried sea bass with spicy thai dressing and was a happier woman for it. The starter was a simple but tasty grilled squid. The dipping sauce was the star of the dish with hints of lemon, garlic, finely chopped chilli, and some other magic. My friend had penang curry with duck which tasted pretty good but not spectacular. I think the sea-bass dishes are the distinguishing dishes at Monkey & Me. A couple of other tables ordered sea-bass dishes (steamed and fried).The restaurant is on the contemporary-modern side of decor; good for enjoying a nice dinner but not comfortable enough to stick around too long after dessert. The servers were friendly and nice. Verdict: Not a place to trek across town for but if you're in the area, it's a good Thai restaurant. Since I live down the street, I asked for a take-out menu and a business card. I'm considering becoming a regular.

_2PP4hzBwdBsShRTnZiRJw.text: An adorable family restaurant with good food but an unfortunately loud atmosphere.

_Jb5ZNuKOK9emkDMoAQ2cA.text: Excellent Thai food & enjoyable dining experience & atmosphere.

PtN9z1dMV1AvgpeS4J9OGw.text: The only good thing I've tried here is the green curry. The noodles are very mediocre, and most everything lacks in seasoning. I only order takeaway, and that's only because it's just around the corner from my flat. Busaba is just a few minutes walk south. It's much better; go there instead.

lx1gvnpul_diobceNa7VGw.text: Monkey and Me delivers average tasting Thai food. Nothing to talk shit or complain about, but nothing to write home about either. There are plenty of other great Thai restaurants in London, and it's just not worth coming back if you're going to miss out on trying all of the others - whether you end up liking them or not.

CXJ2GY-_0uZjYo1GyjI17g.text: Wow ! I mean it. The food was simply FANTASTIC. Relatively small venue, tables a bit too close to each other (that's a minus), elegant ambience, good service. The food, however, outdid everything else. The Tom Yum soup (w/prawns) was probably the best I've ever had: a perfectly balanced mix of flavours, ingredients were all super fresh, beautiful colors the works. When I think of food to warm up your heart, now I think of that soup. Main entree: stir fried prawns with vegs  the prawns were outstandingly fresh, beautifully presented, and perfect color/flavor/texture combination.

xadVxDcRBnFHpytbzscoag.text: Was introduced to this restaurant by a friend when I moved I London about a year ago, it was her favourite restaurant and it has come to be my favourite as well. Never really had Thai food back home (Sweden) but have come to really really enjoy it and monkey and me is the place to go to if you want reasonably priced quality Thai food. Have tried many different dishes and all of them has been a treat. My favourite so far though, is number 39, a duck stew with veggies.

9g5zyn9eVG4hHCFqB4ox2g.text: Really delicious Thai food, extensive menu, and inexpensive. Great value.. Definitely recommend!

VwiIPdTqjn189Ye4vn_5UA.text: Accidentaly found this place when looking for dinner around Baker Street; very pleaseantly suprised by very good Thai food for the price. The steam seabass in particular was excellent!

yuFTwGcff-Z7MSkQQDwECA.text: Am I glad that the tubes got disrupted this evening and had to take a different route home! On recommendation from a friend who works nearby, I went to Monkey and Me for dinner at around 7pm on a Tuesday evening. There's another Thai restaurant just a few doors down but she said this was the better one  and though I haven't been to the other one, I can't argue!Service: Thai staff. Friendly, attentive & efficient. Drinks arrived within 2 minutes of ordering. Starters within 5 minutes and mains at a nice 5 minute interval after the starters. Can't be faulted.Atmosphere: Really lovely. Some easy-listening back ground music, nice decor & lighting. Though I chose to sit outside where they had a couple of tables. So nice to watch the world go by while the sun was setting.A fair few of the tables were reserved already (slightly surprising for a Tuesday evening!) and the one side of the restaurant was just about full. But not noisy at all.Food: presentation was lovely and just looked so yummy. Ingredients clearly high quality. Everything super fresh and piping hot. Taste  just perfect to me. Full of flavour and nothing over-powering despite the fish cakes being spicy. Portions are more than generous!Value for money: Good. Starter of fish cakes, large portion of Thai crackers, sparkling water, gin & tonic, steamed rice and Massaman curry all came to £22 inclusive or service.Would I recommend and go back? YES!

Jx7nIeFtSEHPiKPuQe7oJw.text: I'm a regular customer.  Great food at reasonable prices and it's a nice casual, neighborhood spot.  Takeaway orders are very fast, too.  I love the prawn toast and curries, especially penang or massaman with chicken, with coconut rice.

WnC0YCfjy3eKh1tU_kaUrw.text: Simple decoration, very kind and helpful thai service, the food is amazingly tasty and authentic, really felt like back in thailand, and given the quality and prime location near baker street, very affordable. Highly recommended!

ZgB7Rq4K3Yicwxy3abh-0Q.text: monkey&me is the kind of place that a thai would recommend you to go. isn't that enough guarantee? the menu is long enough to get lost a couple of times, and to lure the waitress to the table before you know a thing to order. let me help you. soups are great, and they are a classic for thai people. either the ones with coconut milk or the glass noddles one will please you. you'll find out why do they call it glass noddles which is already cool.then go for the curries, and, for god shake, once here, ask for the red, and see how your head is about to exploit with chillie. it is all an experience. if you don't stand spicy food, you should not be in a thai in the first place. however, there are a few options, such as duck, which is also great.also to say, tables are small, staff is a bit dumb, but decoration is ok, and the food is authentic.it was cool for me. we pay 40£ for two persons drinking wine and two courses.

o_HaRzYM061hI92jbr25GQ.text: After eating Thai here I don't eat Thai anywhere else! Such yummy food at such great prices too. Definitely worth trying!

IijOetRJ9AH5Tgmwi7xgDQ.text: Discovered this restaurant recently and we really enjoyed the simplicity of the decor, the authenthicity of the menu, the quality of the food. This local restaurant without pretention offers a very varied authentic menu at a good price, and being Lao/Thai myself, I am highly recommending this place for a local nice meal. Watch the chillies :-)

BsT6BKVbMOekZ5Z4HPNUOg.text: Left out the curry from my delivery order. When I called to tell them, they claimed I had received it. I'll never order from them again! Please don't support such an establishment.

KbdPU6Uo5YkTqApsJxzAfw.text: The food was really good but the service was very slow and unattentive. Great prices.

uX3a-t2oudYhiEr2KbR1bg.text: Solid thai food. Small, but decent and appropriately-priced wine list. Fantastic service and cute decor. Not too noisy so you can count on having good conversation with your meal.Curries here are nothing mind-blowing but immensely satisfying. I especially enjoyed the masaman curry with prawn which had the perfect amount of spice and coconut creaminess. I'll also vouch for the green curry. Just make sure to really communicate if you want a dish spicy. The octopus was a little chewy. but not inedible.Bottom line, if you're on a budget but want to act like you're not, come on over here before a night out.

WvfZSB6isO5t3NqU-dc_Lg.text: SO MUCH GOOD!My husband and I went in to this place solely because of the name. Thankfully, the food was just as good as the name!Tasty green curry for me, and chili shrimp starter and spicy squid for my husband.Service was a bit slow but the place was packed on a Saturday night.

VNkfV2FCHA5uTKhxxvsTAw.text: I needed a large take away order for a working lunch meeting and they fulfilled my every request including  opening early to make sure I could get it all back in time. Everyone enjoyed their meal; I had a particularly delicious Thai green chicken curry with sticky rice and I must say they don't hold back on flavour and spices. Will be heading back for their lunch special.

fpV0kaRaGVzMgogDUtsmsQ.text: The ambiance is good...the food is average and the service is very slow... you will die of hunger if you eat here..not a good place to eat if you have limited time...

kFjvvV1-jhT3ZhO3gav2vQ.text: Good Thai food at a great price. The menu is quite large, with many attractive choices. I settled on a vegetable stir-fry with chili paste. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be, but it was very good nonetheless.The atmosphere was pretty good, but a bit loud. The service was friendly, but a bit slow.Overall, it was a very good experience, and I'll be coming back.

lAXH56kgDKffqApu0tY_aA.text: Very cozy place. Pad Thai is a good choice if you do not like spicy food. Red curry with mixed meat is tasty, although I do hope it can be spicier. Tom Kha soup is  so-so.By the way, the staff here was really busy walking in and out.

ds615TpJ-WupripCjnkcEw.text: Best Thai restaurant in London - hands down. Everything I've eaten here has been wonderfully prepared and thoughtfully served. The staff is accommodating and friendly without being too much so. Do yourself a favor and begin with the Monkey starter and take it from there... tom kha, red curry, salads, everything is outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom

GqZTqH2kEJvz9YzZZ9E-vw.text: I really wanted to like the place. It's called Monkey & Me... how cute is that?!?!?! Had the pad si eaw, which is pretty basic Thai. Unfortunately it was not good at all. I've had my share of amazing food traveling though Thailand and this place didn't come close. Noodles were over cooked, lacked seasoning, and dish was soggy.  The search for a good thai place in london continues...

c02wP5wfRANHo59hA2D0BQ.text: Ate here quite late after a work event with my team. Not sure whether I was having an off day or they were. Even though the rest of my party enjoyed it and we did receive good service I felt it was pretty average. We shared some starters and unfortunately the chicken satay was pink and not cooked through - completely put me off my chicken cashew nut stir-fry to be honest. The restaurant is lovely though - maybe on another day I would have experienced what most other yelpers have reviewed it to be.

47uAVFWRpWjb9uwWRQZi4g.text: Great local restaurant with a nice buzzy atmosphere and well-priced food. I've tried many of the dishes on the menu which have all been delicious but the massaman curry is definitely my favourite. Would definitely recommend for good Thai food, plus the lunchtime deal is great value. The only drawback is that on weekends they tend to get pretty busy and service can get a little slower.

gEzXr9-soOBcxJYZWtLOWA.text: Dinner Went there with my friend. The restaurant decoration did not make me feel that I was in Thai restaurant which was not usual but it was new to me. The atmosphere was a bit chic and classy.The starter was reasonably enjoyable as they had a good plate of Try Me Plate. This earned 4 stars - the taste, the volume and the price were really good.There were different variation of rice, which was great. I went coconut rice with green curry. This earned 4 stars too. Actual bits of coconut was contained in rice. Thai curry was relatively creamy and mild. They did not use too much nampula- which tells me that was seasoned carefully = no cheating. However I had to wait ages to get the bill and pay. It was excessive. Thus 3 stars. I think it's fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom

tR0Qcy_9i4PEvJCyGV24nQ.text: 2 stars because the mains were ok. The starters were absolutely terrible. We ordered the starters plate to share for two and I struggled to try them all because they were so fatty and overcooked.The mains were ok, not too bad not too good. I got really upset though when the bill came. They added a beer to it which we did not drink or order. Simply adding items to the bill is one of the worst things that can happen to you as a restaurant but there was no recognition of this by the Monkey & Me staff. They made me feel bad for pointing out the fact that they made a pretty big mistake. Least you can do is say sorry and make sure your guests want to come back.They've lost my trust and I'll not come back here.

3ttbBpqOBA9g3Z05nLhKDg.text: Good place with some nice food - unfortunately service was slow and inattentive but it's worth the wait for the food and it's a great place to take friends for a quiet dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom

voM2F_2S8fCWmuC8TGnhXQ.text: We've eaten at Monkey and Me, as well as ordered delivery, many times. Although we've always enjoyed the food, I would caution against delivery. They have been getting slower and slower lately. Tonight it was two hours for delivery, which was an hour longer than stated. Very disappointing. We'll be ordering delivery from Too Mai going forward.

_QsVXc2-6VOAQU4TcdFEzQ.text: I really wish Yelp had a 3.5 star rating. Because that's what Monkey and Me is... really, a 3.5 * place. The food was good, decent Thai, not flippin fantastic, but fairly functional if you're looking for Thai fair. The decor is actually really sleek, it looks really expensive from the outside and the menus are WELL designed. Someone really went to taking great care on making sure this place is cosy. The food was a little slow in leaving the kitchen and lukewarm by the time it hit the table. Mine was a little more greasy than I'd expect from a place decorated this nicely. Granted, I paid £6.95 for the Pad Kee Mao, for a place that looked like it'd charge me £9.95 for it. Anyway, as another reviewer described, it's nothing to write home about nor to complain about. Just a little mismatch from expectations from the decor, the price and the quality of food. Would I come back? Probably, if I was in the area (which I don't actually live very far), but there are plenty of 3.5* Thai places inbetween where I live and Marylebone.

oTbtQ-J77wzQc2YFGfPjNA.text: I've been to Monkey & Me twice and was thoroughly impressed both times.  Great service and atmosphere.  Each of us has enjoyed everything we ordered.  I don't know that anything we had would be considered "cutting edge", but all of it has been prepared and seasoned very well.  Prices and value are quite reasonable.  We will be regulars!

hHRpSJ7tySNpSfC0IpTtuA.text: Yet another lunch spot near work. The food is good and cheap. It's not the best Thai food I've ever tasted, but they the standard dishes are quite tasty--curries and stir fries are usually a good option. Anything slightly off-piste can be somewhat hit or miss. The staff are just okay. They can be quite short, even rude at times. And there is one thing I find particularly strange. Table setting include very nice wine glasses. However, when you order wine, they take away the nice glassware and provide you with thick rimmed, stout, pub-like wine glasses. We usually request to keep the nice glassware and they always let us do this, but I do feel that we get the evil eye for asking. The restaurant has recently been redesigned--loads of clean lines and pseudo-modern furniture which isn't that comfortable. But I guess when you're out for lunch from work, you don't want to get overly comfortable; you may never make it back.

EgwNS7h2O6tztZzgMvNP0g.text: Let it be known - i ONLY come here for the food ( it is the only local Thai restaurant)  -  as the staff here are SO RUDE! they really have no clue how to serve or show manners, a great shame as otherwise a nicely done place and not expensive.They have recently expanded, though some tables together for 2 still feel like you are dining with strangers with your every word being heard.Wine list & desserts now greatly improved.Less of the rude & less of the hurry please....PS - Where have the candles vanished to??

QK90IgHPCdId98YUUN9d_Q.text: Good place in London for thai food. Cheap prices also.The service was very kind. We had the pad thai and the red curry with coconut steamed rice. Food was good.Not a trendy/fancy restaurant, no need to dress up.The perfect weekday restaurant to go with family and/or friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom. terrasse
Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom. Pad thai

hLX4-v5v1HRvB8agpyTxnw.text: Great food and service! Small and quiet restaurant, location is just far enough from the tourist crowd but still easy to find. Food was delicious. Drinks were served quickly. Prices were reasonable. Definitely check them out!

YluhwUEIL_0smI-c5oWf4g.text: Been here a few times during the week for 'working/social' lunches.Initially caught by the name as I strolled passed one morning, decided to venture in for lunch being a lover or Thai food.Small restaurant but cosy.  They have a full menu as well as a set menu with starter and main option for a fixed price.  Decent variety on the set menu including good ole Pad Thai and Green curry, etc.  As a fan of Pad Thai (who isn't) this was very tasty.  I've also forced myself to order something different on the other occasions I've been and the other meals have also been very tasty and have not felt cheated by not getting my fav Pad Thai.Service is generally prompt and the food tasty with good portion sizes. They certainly do not cut back just because it is a set menu.Can get busy so if you want a guaranteed table then wise to book in advance.I believe they also do take out, great option when they are too busy to accommodate you.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom

26by0D5HeTWRRlsI8dpt9Q.text: We tried two different types of curries and loved it.  Also the appetizer to share was quite good enabling us to sample many different tastes.  If only they also had the pineapple rice that eat in other Thai spots and I have come to love!

XkXFYIE9u3PQ8xxzKFjNsQ.text: Listen, lunch around Baker Street can get a bit dicey. Long ques. Fast food. Crowded seats, you name it -- it's pretty stressful and not terribly enjoyable. So when I find a spot that's a bit tucked away, offers comfortable table service, isn't jam packed to the gills AND has a lunch special!? Well, I'm pretty happy. Set lunch: starter (or soup) + main for £10.95. Or, you can do appetizer + soup + main for just a few quid more. The best part of this is that it flies out of the kitchen. Easy in and out in an hour for lunch breakers!My selections were the Tom Kha mushroom soup + Cashew Chicken stir-fry. Both were quite good and I was impressed with the portion size for the main given it was a lunch deal. Very filling. the Tom Kha was good, though I'd likely opt to add in chicken or something a bit more substantial, a bunch of bobbing mushrooms isn't terribly appealing or filling as it turns out. Though I do love that coconut! Service was just fine. No complaints. Quick and efficient. Will most definitely be back when craving some Thai and needing a respite from the office drones and chains of Baker Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom. Tom kha soup
Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom. Chicken satay starter

YrGqhZ7nb6PEx9ZyX94MVA.text: Simply had the Sua Rong Hai, the signature steak dish with plain white rice. Ordered it medium and It was to cooked to perfection, just the right amount of pink. Flavours were subtle and unique with just the right amount of chillie added. Never had a Thai dish like this before. Wish I had the appetite to try out a couple more dishes.Service was excellent, quiet atmosphere, priced right. Highly recommended. Will be back on my next trip to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Monkey & Me - London, United Kingdom

Cd29C0IvxCuq_z0TrJksyQ.text: We had takeaway and aside from the fact it took donkeys years to arrive (almost 1.5 hours!!), the food was pretty tasty. I had the spicy rice noodles with tofu and veg which did the trick. I also ordered veggie spring rolls which were crispy, a surprise given that they had to travel.

g_8bnJOCQzg5Stx8dwlmjQ.text: We were staying directly across the street from this place while our permanent housing was being set up. Decided to try and happy we did!  As some posters mentioned the service is not the fastest but, the food is delicious.  Our waitress was nice and helpful in making suggestions and accommodations. We didn't venture too far into the menu, pad thai, the steak which my son loved, fried rice was good, tom yum soup was delicious, the keang duck was delicious.  The ambiance is casual and quaint.  Not very noisy, you can have a nice conversation with your dinner partner and not have a  problem hearing.  We will definitely be back.

k3LMAbycZ3Du8dcDrxjv7Q.text: Nice, tasty. Being used to the aussie cost of thai (7 bucks a meal YES YOU HEARD ME RIGHT) I had to adjust to the local pricing - but hey I also pay rent here so twenty quid is no big deal!Quality is great, freshness and right-in-between-raw-and-steamed, spot on.Lunchtime is suity though so avoid unless you're one of THEM.

Sox2PsIAyyARl3yWf3TLUw.text: The ambiance and decor was better than the food. It's closeTo Governors square after work dinner or convenient lunch. Great U.K. service.

3RlhBsnEyNFZZ8rplgn_Fw.text: Very tasty food (try the spicy noodles!) and attentive service. We also had spring rolls to start which were great. I love the fact that it's so close to Baker Street station yet feels completely away from the hustle and bustle.We really enjoyed our meal and will definitely be back!

zxiiUd57rN2ob3a8KFvcGQ.text: Amazing Thai food! The squid and curries are great. It's spicy too, which is how it should be! The service could do with some improvement though.

l_ojZ4vo1XXCEb5BICSB4w.text: Pretty impressive Thai with some dishes that were exceptional. A friendly restaurant at the back of Baker Street which was very welcoming and although had dome difficulty with opening others champagne did pretty well with the service. There were a couple of dishes that set the taste buds alight - coconut rice which I would order every wkend if I could and the signature duck dish which I unfortunately didn't have. My fried see food unfortunately was served cold, but I didn't complain as everyone else was enjoying themselves.

j9sGj1jHGjQ0Z3dAWV0_rA.text: Nice, well executed duck curry served with a smile ;) The duck was tender and well cooked. I feel like I could make this a regular haunt if I lived in the area.

xi1q4bjTNvBMqVEZdTx2zg.text: Thai food can be so good, yet is usually so bad. Thailand, you eat on a stool by the roadside eating some weird skewers and a bowl of steaming noodle soup and its the thing you talk about 10 years later.  Thai food here, sadly, doesn't typically warrant a second thought, let alone years down the line. Monkey & Me won't likely win restaurant of the year at the Consumer Choice Awards like Thai Square (side note: how much did Thai Square have to pay to receive such a prestigious designation?), nor will they get a line up of Thai people to eat food like Mæ used to make, but for like £9 for 5 cute little spring rolls and a huge pad thai which is pretty savoury and delicious, I'd say why not.

uOtDBvU_lWk3OaRNjallPA.text: They have solid Thai Iced Tea and the ambiance is also very nice. I would recommend this place for a quiet Friday night dinner out.

d6qMGLG1qjLH7_g1FPbwBw.text: Very good place! I went there for dinner yesterday night.The restaurant looks nice and feels quite cosy, very good if you actually intend to speak to the person you're dining with (unlike some restaurants I might review later), and the service is attentive but not too much.We had some steamed pork and prawn dumplings (Kanom Jeeb, which are very similar to Siu Mai) as an appetiser with a very good sauce. Then my friend had a tofu curry with some rice and I chose an amazing soup. Fortunately this is a written review so you won't have to suffer through my horrible pronunciation of Guay Tiew Neua, which is the name of said beef noodle soup. Slightly spicy, very flavourful, LOTS of meat, maybe not enough greens. Good broth (I love a good broth!), okay noodles. Cost us about £15 each with non alcoholic drinks (Tea and a big bottle of sparkling water - look at us being healthy!). Most dishes are between £8 and £11. Sides around £3.

tAdN9Tvi9Vq4UiH3E0TNqQ.text: 3.5 stars (.5 extra for service)The staff here are so nice and so accommodating, but the food doesn't live up.On a Saturday around 8 pm it was packed, so I'd recommend making reservations. There wasn't a queue, but all tables were reserved. Each person we came into contact was very nice and patient with any questions or customizations. We ended up ordering the panang curry with veggies and the stir fry thai basil with veggies. The thai basil stir fry was ordered extra spicy. Unfortunately, that dish was a miss - so bland, no flavor. It tasted just like regular brown sauce. When we informed the waitress, she was very willing to make a different dish. We ended up getting the chili stir fry, which was definitely better, but still not amazingly flavorful. Also, it wasn't made extra spicy as requested, but we didn't really want to have them remake it, so we just got chili powder on the side.The mixed veggies were a good variety - bell peppers, baby corn, broccoli, bamboo, onion, carrot, string beans, mushrooms, zucchini.They were so nice about everything and kept checking in to make sure the experience was good, so that's a huge plus. But the taste just wasn't there. I wish the food was more flavorful. It's possible if I were in the area I would try it again only for the service and just hope that the food was better, but otherwise, it's not the best.

AEn_v2kEIwM7wbF-B7Y5iA.text: Good Thai food at a pretty cheap price!I've been here many times and I've always loved their food. My favorite is the red curry with mixed meat, but also the green curry is pretty tasty.They're only slightly spicy, even if on the menu it's written that they are stronger, so you can have them even if you don't like too spicy food.Their Pad Thai is also very good if you're not into curries. However I didn't find any particularly inviting starter.The service is usually pretty fast and friendly.I'd suggest to book a table for dinner since they're always pretty full, but if you're max 4 people you can usually find a free table even without reservation.

ZaWB6H-5bBAH27kNLiggGA.text: A very good option for a working lunch in the Baker St/ Marylebone area, they have a set menu which I think (if my memory serves me right) is about 10.95 for 2 courses. Lovely starters - prawn toast a personal fave. Like 90% of all people, I had the pad thai for mains (which I've had a few times here before) and it was lovely. Big portion though, couldn't finish it. It's quite busy on Thursday and Friday lunchtimes, so call ahead and book if you can. Tip - do not get the "thai iced tea". You'll be thinking, " yay, I'm getting a lovely clear teabag stewed, icey refreshing drink." What you'll actually get is a revolting orangutan orange sweet milky monstrosity of doom. Avoid at all costs. Sans the aforementioned drink, you'll be safe as houses, because Monkey & Me is really pretty darn good overall.
